resources.string: Create and easily manage your Github page blog.

Tinypress (tinypress.co) allows you create and manage your Github page blog. (Github pages are simple static websites [and blog] for you and your projects). For now, this mobile version is limited to managing (creating, editing and deleting) posts. The web version allows you create a page if you do not have one already.
What information is collected and stored?

Tinypress requests access to your Github public repos to authenticate you, check if you have a Github page blog and pull your posts. Your profile details (username, name, page repo) and access to your public repo are stored on your device. Posts are also cached (temporarily stored) on your device during the active session.
